sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph G:

![Graph G](https://imgur.com/Y8wWzLr.png)

Does the graph G have a Hamiltonian cycle? If yes, provide one cycle that visits all of the vertices of the graph exactly once. If not, provide a brief explanation of why.
message_2:
Yes, the graph G has a Hamiltonian cycle. One such cycle is:

A → B → C → D → E → F → G → H → I → J → K → L → M → N → O → P → A

This cycle visits all of the vertices of the graph exactly once and returns to the starting vertex A.
